title: Needs commit and push
comment: Not worth buying until these are implemented

title: Read-only client!
comment: This app can only clone & pull to an Android device, not commit or push. This is explained on the project's GitHub page but could be made clearer on the App Store page

title: Great app, very stable
comment: the app works very well, it enables me to check out code right on my device from remote git server. I downloaded a pirated version first, but now I'm back to buy the official app.  $2.5 is totally worth it.
Needs Push

title: nice app
comment: it's good. i want app like this. but, i want the feature that show github and bitbucket url sample or show url candidate. i forget full-url in every-git-clone.
Doesn't work with xp dev

title: Exactly what I needed
comment: It can clone and fetch privately hosted repos over SSH on a non-standard port with only public key authentication.  Make sure you read his docs on his ConnectBot port first.  Great work, I can code-review on the move!

title: Why bitbucket not support?
comment: Buy the program but cant clone the puhlic repo on bitbucket. The repo from github cloned fine. Why bitbucket not supported? Why?

Hi Aydar - cloning from BitBucket should work, and there's actually been some explicit support for BitBucket urls in Agit for quite a while: https://github.com/rtyley/agit/pull/69 - can you give me the url of the public BitBucket repo that failed to clone?

title: Lifesaver app
comment: Some UI and usability quirks (eg diff display may be hard to follow properly, some basic commit and push ability would be great), but nevertheless a little free software gem very useful to study code on the go. Lifesaver as file sync trick for my sdcard-less tablet too.

title: Perfect for viewing history.
comment: Agit does exactly what it states. View diffs and history of a Git project easily and intuitively. I only wish you could also view source code.

title: very good app!
comment: The app is very fast and easy to use, cloning is very straightforward and the support via mail is very responsive (reply came during the same day). I hope that in the near future this supports push. Then it will be even more awesome. Very good work!

title: Crashes all the time
comment: When checking diffs. Unacceptable. Please fix.
Missing push

title: Can we get unified diffs?
comment: The current diff capability is a little buggy (new and old show in a smaller font) and the slider is clunky (hard to hit the right spot).  In any case, unified line-by-line diffs would be great -- that's just git diff output.

title: Great app!
comment: I tried the other clients on the store but none of them had the functionality that this one has. Worth the price. Looking forward to more.

title: Push please
comment: Hi. I'm really satisfied with the cloning and pulls. I hope you will complete commit and push. Will increase to 5 stars for push.

title: Excellent app
comment: Clean interface. Would be even better if it had push ability.

title: Rather disingenuous
comment: It says it supports HTTP/HTTPS, but I tried to clone my own gitolite managed HTTP-served repos, with no success. I wasn't given a prompt to enter my password, so I assume that the support for HTTP authentication is not there. Big shame.

Agit does indeed support HTTP authentication, you can see full details here: https://github.com/rtyley/agit/wiki/HTTP

- hope that helps, let me know if you have any further problems!

title: Great app!
comment: Agit is easy to use and looks great. Cool integration of public keys through ConnectBot. Nice diff feature lets you move a slider and graphically emphasize/de-emphasize the old and new text.

title: Fast and easy to use
comment: Agit is quite a nice implementation, nicely layouted and focussed on important information. And indeed, very responsive developer!

title: Excellent!
comment: Responsive dev, definitely worth buying. Easy to grab the repo, view it and have the files available as well.

title: Pretty good
comment: I normally wouldn't buy a basic git client, but the fact that it is open source makes it worth the money. It is an extremely well done client and is useful when I want to browse my coffee on the go. Two features that it needs, though are a file list with expandable folders instead of just a file list, and the ability to remember passwords for when I download private repositories. With these features, this app would get a five star rating from me.
Good customer service

title: This is perfect :-)
comment: Exactly what I needed thanks!

title: Fantastic start
comment: Hoping purchase will move agit a little towards commit ability :) Thank you very much.

title: Good software, very responsive dev
comment: I didnt read the wiki (Didnt know where to find it either) so I contacted the dev with some questions. Roberto was very quick to respond and worked with me until all my questions and problems were resolved. Very responsive and helpfull dev. :) And good software!  And obviously, no commit etc, but I only need bare checkout, so no problem there!

title: Needs checkout, commit and push
comment: My own fault for not reading that it didn't have checkout, commit or push capabilities, but really surprised that it's offered as a paid app, when it doesn't really offer you anything more than a Web interface.  I've gone for AIDE instead, more expensive, but has a full git usage, connects successfully with OpenSS config files and keys, and has a full and proper Source editor to boot. For me, it's everything this app aspires to be.

title: Good Start
comment: As others have said, this app needs commit and push capabilities before it is worth the money. It's a good start, but I almost never find myself needing to use my tablet to just look at a repository and browse history. I need the ability to commit to the repository and push to origin.  Once that is done I suspect the popularity of this app will skyrocket.  It's already the closest thing we have to a functioning git environment on android.  I hope the author actually finishes it.

title: Commiting/Pushing
comment: There is real need to implement commiting and pushing to organize full development process...

title: Great job
comment: Well done, it worth the price

title: Lacking...
comment: Needs push/pull

title: An ok app, but missing vital development features
comment: The application clones repositories well (once the ssh-agent is installed for ssh support). Non-bare repositories do not seem to support branch selection, so only master can be checked out. Fine for if you just want to browse the contents of a repository and keep up-to-date with it, but not for anyone who wants to do actual development from their android device. commit and push features are stated to be coming, so this may change things.
Great app cannot wait until push and commit is implimented. A fantastic start to androids first git client :)

title: works great, would be nice to open files directly
comment: Beyond having to use a separate file manager to open files in the repo, I love it.  It sync's over ssh like butter.  Make sure you have the version of connectbot with ssh-agent in it's title (and installed before this) and don't have another ssh client installed, had some issues having vx-connectbot installed as well, but once removed it worked like a charm.

title: Fantastic hit app
comment: Hands down love it. Check commits and branches anywhere. Even supports SSH. Setup is a bit hard but after that smooth sailing. Thanks

title: Perfect
comment: The code quality is great, you can really learn something from this awesome product. Be sure to check out the articles about the development, too. The app itself is super useful for checking out the latest updates on a repository, even private ones.

title: Great, wish it had just a few more features..
comment: Great, wish it had integrated tree / source browsing.

title: Great
comment: This is a really good app. It does what it says, Roberto is really responsive to getting any issues corrected, including the latest fix which corrects downloading larger files from your git repo. Only issue that I have, would be to commit local changes to your git repo. Once this is implemented, it will be awesome sauce! Thanks for the great app!

title: Great
comment: The best git client for android bar none, reactive to updates too.

title: GPLv3!
comment: Really great that we have a Free and Open Source Android Git client in the making! Please mention the license in the description. Very much looking forward to commit/push though, it's essential. I've bought this to help support development of the missing features.

title: Where are cloned files?
comment: Hi Roberto,  I do editing on my phone and I've already configured git on my home server to act like drop box.  Where is the repository downloaded to? I can find /sdcard/git-repos but all that is there is the git control files, where is the repository itself?  Obviously my next request is please can we have commits and push?  Thanks Mark

title: pay for more
comment: great app! would be willing to pay a coin for more features..

title: Works really well
comment: I can create bare repositories to view the changes from my phone.
we need push push push ;)

title: Works great
comment: Does what it says, nice interface...and best of all it works. Great app!

title: great for code review away from the desk
comment: This is pure awesome. I can review changes from the bus, the bathroom, the park, the lunch break, keep my head in the code at all times if I please. Regarding other reviews: easier importing of github repos would be nice; I don't care much for implementing the push feature (until I get a bluetooth keyboard, my smartphone is not my development environment). Tough little app, nice animated diffs, might be addictive.

title: Slick - I just wish it could push changes
comment: Simple UI, everything works exactly how you'd expect. I have the notion of using git as a sort of self-hosted dropbox, but I need to be able to push to the remote repo which this app doesn't yet support. I'll happily give it the 5th star when that feature is added :)

title: Good app for checking my repos
comment: Would be amazing if it automatically could list all my GitHub repository and watched repos
Ideal for uber geeks.

title: Beautiful and usable
comment: Looks pretty, works well, and even comes with some nice example repos to get you started. Take note, github!
